alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Ojo Encino, or 18 miles west of Cuba, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuba, Regina and La Jara. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 66 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands
